newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks close lower on Moody's review.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks close lower on Moody's review.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished lower on Tuesday after Moody's Investors Service Inc put Pakistan under review for possible downgrade, dealers said.
"The market went down slowly, as technically it is already oversold," dealer Hina Akhlaq of KASB & Co said. She said the action by Moody's could pull the index further down.

The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index fell 12.20 points, or 0.86 percent, to close at 1,405.85. Declining scrips outnumbered advancers 129 to 88. PTCL fell 0.70 rupees to 33.50 rupees and Hub Power Co 1.25 to 33.50.
